dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...just a really fantastic initiative, tying into their cultural traditions with Korisu kuni, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...just a really fantastic initiative, tying into their cultural traditions with Korisu kuni, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 14, as part of the celebration of Korisu kuni (Meeting Day - ed.), Almaty will host a promotion for foreign guests...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, come on, "fantastic"? Really? It's, uh, just a PR stunt, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, come on, fantastic? Really? It's, uh, just a P R stunt, wouldn't you say?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: No, I don't think so. It's about genuine hospitality, welcoming people. Special guides, helping them navigate. What's wrong with that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, I don't think so. It's about genuine hospitality, welcoming people. Special guides, helping them navigate. What's wrong with that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Passengers arriving in the city on international flights will receive special guides to Almaty. This route guide will help tourists easily navigate the city...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: What's wrong with it? It's the Border Service of the National Security Committee handing out tourist guides. That's not "hospitality," that's, like, security monitoring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What's wrong with it? It's the Border Service of the National Security Committee handing out tourist guides. That's not hospitality, that's, like, security monitoring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Almaty will host a promotion for foreign guests jointly with the Border Service of the National Security Committee and Almaty International Airport...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: No, that's just logistics! They're at the airport, working with the airport. It's practical. It's about the "Best City Experience."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, that's just logistics! They're at the airport, working with the airport. It's practical. It's about the Best City Experience.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The initiative is part of the Best City Experience program, which aims to improve the quality of tourism services and create a positive image of Almaty as a welcoming and culturally rich destination.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: "Best City Experience." Yeah, with a guide telling you about "city services." Who, uh, who wants that from national security?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Best City Experience. Yeah, with a guide telling you about city services. Who, uh, who wants that from national security?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The guide also contains information on transport and city services so that guests can comfortably move around the metropolis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Itâ€™s about building a positive image, attracting tourists. Mastercard even says high service means more repeat visits.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's about building a positive image, attracting tourists. Mastercard even says high service means more repeat visits.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Mastercard, a high level of service contributes to an increase in the number of repeat visits: in 2024, their share reached 25%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Mastercard says that because they benefit from transactions! This isn't about cultural enrichment, it's about, like, transactional tourism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mastercard says that because they benefit from transactions! This isn't about cultural enrichment, it's about, like, transactional tourism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But it explicitly mentions Korisu kuni, that tradition of openness and strengthening ties. They're embracing that!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it explicitly mentions Korisu kuni, that tradition of openness and strengthening ties. They're embracing that!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Korisu kuni is a holiday that symbolizes friendliness, openness, and a warm attitude towards everyone who comes to Kazakhstan. It is based on the tradition of exchanging handshakes and kind words, strengthening ties between people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: They're using it. They're co-opting a meaningful tradition for a very, uh, sterile promotion. Over 5,000 passengers, 50 international flights, it's a numbers game.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're using it. They're co-opting a meaningful tradition for a very, uh, sterile promotion. Over five thousand passengers, fifty international flights, it's a numbers game.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The promotion is expected to cover more than 5 thousand passengers on over 50 international flights.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So you're saying helping tourists find their way, learn about sights, isn't, uh, genuinely good?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So you're saying helping tourists find their way, learn about sights, isn't, uh, genuinely good?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This route guide will help tourists easily navigate the city, get acquainted with its sights, and learn more about cultural traditions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Not when it feels this orchestrated, this performative. It's not the same as someone shaking your hand and offering you tea, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not when it feels this orchestrated, this performative. It's not the same as someone shaking your hand and offering you tea, is it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It's a modern way of showing that spirit, I think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a modern way of showing that spirit, I think.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's a corporate brochure, uh, pretending to be a handshake. I completely disagree. It's a step towards... Yeah, a step towards, like, more monitored tourism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's a corporate brochure, uh, pretending to be a handshake. I completely disagree. It's a step towards... Yeah, a step towards, like, more monitored tourism.
